Title:
Morphological and molecular data reveal cryptic speciation in
Lasiodiplodia theobromae.
Abstract:
Lasiodiplodia theobromae is a common pathogen that occurs
on a large number of hosts in the tropics and subtropics. A collection
of isolates identified as L. theobromae was studied on the basis of
sequence data from the ITS region and EF1-alpha gene. Phylogenetic
analyses identified three well-supported clades within this group of
isolates, one corresponding to L. theobromae and two others
corresponding to potential cryptic species. The distinct phylogenetic
position of the two clades is supported by differences in conidial
morphology and these are, therefore, described as new species,
Lasiodiplodia pseudotheobromae sp. nov. and Lasiodiplodia parva sp.
nov.
